item.title: Comiket 98 Has Been Cancelled!
item.dc:creator: Spookie
item.description:
Comiket, Japan’s largest doujinshi (self-published works like manga or novels) publishing market and anime convention has decided to cancel its 98th event due to the coronavirus pandemic that’s affecting everyone worldwide. The cancellation of Comiket will be the first in 45 years of history since its first conception. With a little over a month before …

The post Comiket 98 Has Been Cancelled! appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
Comiket, Japan’s largest doujinshi (self-published works like manga or novels) publishing market and anime convention has decided to cancel its 98th event due to the coronavirus pandemic that’s affecting everyone worldwide.

The cancellation of Comiket will be the first in 45 years of history since its first conception. With a little over a month before the event was planned, Comiket organizers apologized profusely with their fan base and explained their reasoning for the cancellation in an official announcement on their website.

“Comiket 98 (to be held from May 2nd to May 5th, 2020 at Tokyo Big Sight) will be cancelled in an attempt to prevent the spread of the COVID-19 infection aka Coronavirus.

The government and the Tokyo Metropolitan Government are attempting to prevent any and all large-scale events to avoid the spread of the Coronavirus infection due to its dangerous nature. This is reinforced via the Japan Recommendation bill that was agreed on with a panel of experts on March 19th, 2020.

For us it was very difficult decision to cancel the event but the safety of everyone attending is more important than anything else. We hope you can understand.”

Refunds & Merchandise

Comiket will be offering refunds for vendors who have already paid for parking and lottery allotted positions in the event hall.

The Comiket 98 catalog will still be sold as printing and binding has already begun, would-be attendees and fans are asked to purchase the catalog in spite of the event cancellation, to show their support for the event.

Sources

Comiket Official Website

The post Comiket 98 Has Been Cancelled! appeared first on VNN.

For those who may be interested, preorders for …

The post Hatsune Miku: Magical Mirai 2019 Tokyo Concert Setlist (Spoilers!), Magical Mirai 2020 Announced appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
With the passing of the final performance in Tokyo, Hatsune Miku: Magical Mirai 2019 has finally came to a close, and the Tokyo concert setlist is also now online, thanks to the tweets by @jt4mtb. While bearing many similarities to Osaka’s, we’d like you to personally check out the Tokyo concert setlist below.

For those who may be interested, preorders for Blu-ray & DVD are still open on AmiAmi and CDJapan, featuring complete recording of the final show in Tokyo including the encore. Check out our Osaka concert setlist article for more details → https://www.mikufan.com/?p=27962

Magical Mirai 2019 https://magicalmirai.com/2019/

01. Teo by Omoi feat. Hatsune Miku (R3 real-time control system)
02. All I Need are Things I Like by PinocchioP feat. Hatsune Miku (R3 real-time control system)
03. Love Song by LamazeP feat. Hatsune Miku (R3 real-time control system)
MC
04. Kaisei by Orangestar feat. Hatsune Miku (R3 real-time control system)
05. Deep Sea City Underground by tanakaB feat. Kagamine Rin
06. Main Character by *Luna feat. Kagamine Len V4X
07-DAY1 BRING IT ON by GigaP feat. Kagamine Rin & Len (Kagamine Rin & Len 10th anniversary)
07-DAY2 Roki by MikitoP feat. Kagmine Rin
07-DAY3 Romeo and Cinderella by doriko feat. Hatsune Miku
08-DAY1 Karakuri Pierrot by 40mP feat. Hatsune Miku
08-DAY2 Sand Planet by Hachi feat. Hatsune Miku (Hatsune Miku 10th anniversary)
08-DAY3 Karakuri Pierrot by 40mP feat. Hatsune Miku
09-DAY1 Catch the Wave by kz feat. Hatsune Miku (Project DIVA MEGA39’s/Mega Mix)
09.DAY2 Animal Fortune-Telling by scop feat. Hatsune Miku
09-DAY3 Catch the Wave by kz feat. Hatsune Miku (Project DIVA MEGA39’s/Mega Mix)
10-DAY1 Baby Maniacs By HachioujiP feat. Hatsune Miku
10-DAY2 Baby Maniacs By HachioujiP feat. Hatsune Miku
10-DAY3 BRING IT ON by GigaP feat. Kagamine Rin & Len (Kagamine Rin & Len 10th anniversary)
11. Kill Carry On by Police Paccadilly feat. Hatsune Miku
12. A Plan is Still in Progress Covertly by Shinra feat. Hatsune Miku (Magical Mirai 2019 Song Contest)
13. Ramnade Blue Longing by Aoto Kei feat. MEIKO
14. Never Die by Yuyoyuppe feat. Megurine Luka
15-DAY1 Stardust Utopia by otetsu feat. Megurine Luka (V4X remake)
15-DAY2 Stardust Utopia by otetsu feat. Megurine Luka (V4X remake)
15-DAY3 Dreamin Chuchu by emon feat. Megurine Luka (together with Hatsune Miku & Kagamine Rin)
16-DAY1 Luka Luka★Night Fever by samfree feat. Megurine Luka
16-DAY2 Just be Friends by Dixie Flatline feat. Megurine Luka
16-DAY3 Luka Luka★Night Fever by samfree feat. Megurine Luka
17. Even If It’s Your Happiness by HeavenzP feat. Megurine Luka
18. Jump for Joy by EasyPop feat. Hatsune Miku & Megurine Luka (Megurine Luka 10th anniversary)
BAND MEMBER INTRODUCTION
19. Ohedo Julia-Night by Mitchie M feat. Hatsune Miku & KAITO
20. With Your Steady Eyes by Mitchie M feat. Hatsune Miku
21. HIBANA by DECO＊27 feat. Hatsune Miku
22. Greenlights Serenade by Omoi feat. Hatsune Miku (Magical Mirai 2018 theme song)
MC 
23. Until I Throw My Dreams Away and Become an Adult by Kasamura Touta feat. Hatsune Miku

ENCORE
24-DAY1 Unknown Mother Goose by wowaka feat. Hatsune Miku
24-DAY2 World’s End Dancehall by wowaka feat. Hatsune Miku
24-DAY3 Rolling Girl by wowaka feat. Hatsune Miku
25. Hand in Hand by kz feat. Hatsune Miku (Magical Mirai 2015 theme song)
26. Bless Your Breath by Wada Takeaki feat. Hatsune Miku (Magical Mirai 2019 theme song)

ライブ最終公演が終了！これで、初音ミク「マジカルミライ 2019」全日程が終了しました！6日間の動員数はライブ・企画展合わせ、約5万人となりました！ご来場の皆様ありがとうございました！！https://t.co/UU22L8ZrcQ #マジカルミライ2019 #初音ミク #鏡音リン #鏡音レン #巡音ルカ #MEIKO #KAITO pic.twitter.com/qSj8fHbxOs

— 初音ミク マジカルミライ 公式 (@magicalmirai) September 1, 2019

Following the closing performance in Tokyo also comes the announcement for Hatsune Miku: Magical Mirai 2020! The event will be held at INTEX Osaka in Osaka on August 7th~9th, 2020, and Makuhari Messe in Tokyo on December 18th~20th, 2020.

The announcement came as the performance came to a close, and it sure had the crowd shook in excitement! Be sure to follow the official Magical Mirai Twitter if you haven’t already, and stay tuned for more info!

Magical Mirai 2020 https://magicalmirai.com/2020/
Magical Mirai Twitter https://twitter.com/magicalmirai

初音ミク「マジカルミライ 2020」は、2020年8月7日（金）～9日（日）にインテックス大阪、12月18日（金）～20日（日）に幕張メッセで開催します！ https://t.co/E9fUjxmNW0

#マジカルミライ2020 #マジカルミライ2019 #初音ミク #鏡音リン #鏡音レン #巡音ルカ #MEIKO #KAITO pic.twitter.com/e99Qv6u9d7

— 初音ミク マジカルミライ 公式 (@magicalmirai) September 1, 2019

Source: Mikufan.com

The post Hatsune Miku: Magical Mirai 2019 Tokyo Concert Setlist (Spoilers!), Magical Mirai 2020 Announced appeared first on VNN.

item.title: Hatsune Miku: Magical Mirai 2019 News Update (July 12th)
item.dc:creator: mikufan.com
item.description:
Today’s news update for Hatsune Miku: Magical Mirai 2019 has brought quite a list! We have more official goods details release, exhibition booth map details revealed, details on an all-new life-size Hatsune Miku statue, Megurine Luka 10th Anniversary exhibition announcement, and more! Check out the info below: Tickets Release Starting from July 13th at 10:00 …

The post Hatsune Miku: Magical Mirai 2019 News Update (July 12th) appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
Today’s news update for Hatsune Miku: Magical Mirai 2019 has brought quite a list! We have more official goods details release, exhibition booth map details revealed, details on an all-new life-size Hatsune Miku statue, Megurine Luka 10th Anniversary exhibition announcement, and more! Check out the info below:

Tickets Release

Starting from July 13th at 10:00 JST, tickets for the live performances, exhibitions, and special live (Osaka only) will be released to the public. The release will follow a first come, first served basis, so be sure to keep an eye out!

Osaka tickets: https://magicalmirai.com/2019/osaka_ticket.html
Tokyo tickets: https://magicalmirai.com/2019/tokyo_ticket.html

Official Goods

A total of 22 new items have been added to the official Magical Mirai 2019 merchandise list. The newly added items to the list are: full graphic t-shirt, cable accessories, lucky charms, sweets cans, 2 way shoulder bag, acrylic diorama, 3D card-type pouches, B2 Tapestries, key case, mini Nobori, towels, acrylic key holder, big cool blanket, ticket holder, and jewelry. Some goods are exclusive to Osaka or Tokyo venues only, so be wary!

Official Goods: https://magicalmirai.com/2019/goods.html

Exhibition Admission Privilege

Visitors to the Magical Mirai 2019 exhibitions in Osaka and Tokyo alike will receive a mini acrylic stand featuring visuals by ni02 as admission privilege. Please note that the mini acrylic stands will be randomly given out of the six designs, and the privilege may end as soon as the goods are all gone.

Osaka exhibitions: https://magicalmirai.com/2019/osaka_ex.html
Tokyo exhibitions: https://magicalmirai.com/2019/tokyo_ex.html

Exhibition Booth Map

Details of the exhibition booths and their maps are now available! Check out the collaborations with various companies, along with sales of various goods, as marked on the maps below. More booths will follow soon.

Osaka Booths: https://magicalmirai.com/2019/osaka_sponsor.html
Tokyo Booths: https://magicalmirai.com/2019/tokyo_sponsor.html

Free-Viewing Acoustic Stage for Tokyo

For Tokyo only, a new stage has been announced to the Free-viewing Stage featuring Hayashi Kei & HoehoeP/nanou in acoustic style performances. The two will be performing on September 1st at 15:00~16:00 JST.

Free-viewing Stage: https://magicalmirai.com/2019/tokyo_ex_stage

Organized Display

“Future Circus” Exhibition

An all-new life-size Hatsune Miku statue styled in Magical Mirai 2019 outfit will be exhibited at the event!

Megurine Luka 10th Anniversary exhibition

Similar to last year’s Kagamine Rin & Len 10th anniversary, there’ll be a special display dedicated to Megurine Luka 10th anniversary! A venue-wide puzzle solving game will also be held.

Piapro Square

In addition to the annual Piapro Wall and life-size panel exhibitions, there will be an addition of Live Paint. There will also be activities involving Snow & Sakura Miku. In a cosplay area there will be a “mysterious box” placed there. What could be inside?

Osaka Exhibition: https://magicalmirai.com/2019/osaka_ex.html
Tokyo Exhibition: https://magicalmirai.com/2019/tokyo_ex.html

Special Illustration Gallery

The special illustration gallery grows further with the additions of two new lovely visuals by KEI & Kinako Mochi! Check out more Hatsune Miku visuals styled in Magical Mirai 2019 theme in the gallery below.

Special Illustration Gallery: https://magicalmirai.com/2019/special.html#special_gallery

Opening Countdown

Finally, there will be opening countdowns for both Osaka and Tokyo venues on August 9th and 31st, respectively. Please note that only photos are not permitted, and there’s no viewing space for general visitors.

August 9th Osaka: Yuu Asakawa (Megurine Luka’s voice provider), Miku Dayo, Tokyo MX’s Yume Lion, Hiroyuki Itoh (Crypton Future Media CEO), and Hiroshi Date (Tokyo MX CEO).

August 31st Tokyo: Saki Fujita (Hatsune Miku’s voice provider), Miku Dayo, Tokyo MX’s Yume Lion, Hiroyuki Itoh (Crypton Future Media CEO), and Hiroshi Date (Tokyo MX CEO).

Hatsune Miku: Magical Mirai 2019 will take place at Intex Osaka in Osaka from August 9th~11th, and Makuhari Messe in Tokyo from August 31st ~ September 1st. Stay tuned!

Hatsune Miku: Magical Mirai 2019: https://magicalmirai.com/2019/

Via Magical Mirai 2019 Official Website

 

Source: Mikufan.com

The post Hatsune Miku: Magical Mirai 2019 News Update (July 12th) appeared first on VNN.

item.title: SEGA Announces Project Diva 10th Anniversary Event Starting July 13th in Akihabara
item.dc:creator: mikufan.com
item.description:
Starting on July 13th, 2019, SEGA will be holding a Hatsune Miku: Project Diva 10th anniversary celebration event in Akihabara, Japan! There you’ll be able to enjoy exhibition activities, free gifts arcades, a stamp rally with a reward, and more! The event will run until August 12th. Check out the full details below! Project DIVA …

The post SEGA Announces Project Diva 10th Anniversary Event Starting July 13th in Akihabara appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
Starting on July 13th, 2019, SEGA will be holding a Hatsune Miku: Project Diva 10th anniversary celebration event in Akihabara, Japan! There you’ll be able to enjoy exhibition activities, free gifts arcades, a stamp rally with a reward, and more! The event will run until August 12th. Check out the full details below!

Project DIVA 10th Anniversary Exhibition

Location: Akib@ko (SEGA Akihabara 5th Building, 5th floor)
Dates: July 13th~August 12th

Various Miku related prize figures, character cutouts of modules chosen by arcade staff, and original drinks with coasters will be exhibited.

There are 3 kinds of Mikudayo coasters to collect, all with new artwork created for this campaign.

Stamp Rally

Location: SEGA Akihabara Buildings 1~5
Dates: July 13th~August12th

Collect all stamps from each of SEGA’s buildings in Akihabara to collect a free memorial postcard! Entry to the stamp rally is free, so participate by all means!

Project Diva Prize Campaign

Location: SEGA Akihabara Buildings 1~5
Dates: July 13th ~ August 12th

SEGA staff will award you one clear file from the 5 above at random whenever you put 500 yen into a UFO catcher prize machine! Be sure to alert an arcade staff member when inserting the money to claim your free gift. Additionally, new SEGA limited prizes will be available at arcades. These will include visual acrylic boards (7 kinds), and Mikudayo acrylic keychains (6 kinds).

Sale of “Mikudayo Yaki”

Location: SEGA Akihabara 5th Building (1st Floor)
Dates: July 21st~September 6th

Mikudayo motif versions of the popular Taiyaki snack food (a fish shaped pancake filled with bean jam) will be sold at the SEGA #5 building in Akihabara, and will also earn buyers a reward of a Mikudayo can badge as a gift, with 3 possible designs. The “Mikudayo Yaki” will be available in either the traditional bean flavor filling, or a cream filling.

Enjoy the celebrations in Akihabara should you happen to be in the area!

Via SEGA Miku Blog

 

Source: Mikufan.com

The post SEGA Announces Project Diva 10th Anniversary Event Starting July 13th in Akihabara appeared first on VNN.

item.title: Official Goods, Exhibition & Digital Stars Event Announced for Miku Expo 2019 in Hong Kong
item.dc:creator: mikufan.com
item.description:
The Miku Expo 2019 official site has finished updating with info for official goods, exhibition and workshop activities, and the Digital Stars live DJ event! The list of official includes T-shirts, a Happi Coat, wall scrolls, wristbands, glowsticks, hats, powerbanks, mugs and more! The current list is included in the screenshots above, but may be …

The post Official Goods, Exhibition & Digital Stars Event Announced for Miku Expo 2019 in Hong Kong appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
The Miku Expo 2019 official site has finished updating with info for official goods, exhibition and workshop activities, and the Digital Stars live DJ event!

The list of official includes T-shirts, a Happi Coat, wall scrolls, wristbands, glowsticks, hats, powerbanks, mugs and more! The current list is included in the screenshots above, but may be updated later on the official site: https://mikuexpo.com/twhk2019/goods.html

Hong Kong’s Digital Stars event will be held at the “TTN This Town Needs” venue on July 26th from 7:00 PM~11:00 PM. All ages are allowed, and tickets are still available.

The list of DJs for this event includes:

  •  HachiojiP
  • BIGHEAD
  • DJ NINJA
  • ＊蛍＊
  • EMU

An exhibition of goods and workshop activities will be set up at the KITEC – EMAX venue, and will have free entrance to anyone wanting to join in and check it out! It will be open July 25th~26th from 11:00 AM~8:00 PM, and July 27th from 10:00 AM~11:00 PM.

Miku Expo 2019 in TW & HK Official Site: https://mikuexpo.com/twhk2019/

 

Source: Mikufan.com

The post Official Goods, Exhibition & Digital Stars Event Announced for Miku Expo 2019 in Hong Kong appeared first on VNN.

item.title: VOCABERLIN ✖ Luo Tianyi 7th Anniversary Event!
item.dc:creator: Cinzya
item.description:
Berlin wants to celebrate Luo Tianyi‘s 7th Anniversary, therefore VOCABERLIN invites everyone to their “Luo Tianyis Birthday @ VOCABERLIN 2019” fan meeting held on July 12th at METRONOM in Berlin, Germany. What is VOCABERLIN? VOCABERLIN is a non-commercial circle and fan club that supports the music and art scene in Germany with the help of …

The post VOCABERLIN ✖ Luo Tianyi 7th Anniversary Event! appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
Berlin wants to celebrate Luo Tianyi‘s 7th Anniversary, therefore VOCABERLIN invites everyone to their “Luo Tianyis Birthday @ VOCABERLIN 2019” fan meeting held on July 12th at METRONOM in Berlin, Germany.

What is VOCABERLIN?

VOCABERLIN is a non-commercial circle and fan club that supports the music and art scene in Germany with the help of vocal synths. For nearly one year, they have been hosting events for fans by fans in celebration of various vocal synths. This small team of vocal synth fans from all over the world are aiming to create a local community for vocal synth fans in Berlin.

Event Details

Together with the help of JAMBerlin and METRONOM, a facility for kids and adolescents in Berlin Reinickendorf/Tegel, VOCABERLIN wants to give fans an opportunity to meet and celebrate Luo Tianyis 7th anniversary in Germany. You’ll be able to sing karaoke, play games like DanceDanceRevolution or various card games, and see exciting acts like the German odorite dancer Koyuki Mizuno. They’ll make sure you won’t get bored!

Date: Friday, July 12th

Venue: METRONOM (recreational , sports and cultural center)
Sterkrader Straße 44, 13507 Berlin

Time: 7 PM ~ 0 PM (GMT+1)

Entrance Fee: 2 Euro (the money goes back to JAMBerlin as a contribution towards costs. VOCABERLIN is not making any profit off it!)

Program

7 PM (GMT+1) – Start

8 PM (GMT+1) – Double L performance

8:30 PM (GMT+1) – Koyuki Mizuno performance

9:30 PM ~ 10:20 PM (GMT+1) – “Phoenix out of the Ashes” VOCALOID theater play

10:30 PM ~ 11 PM (GMT+1) – Taboo: “VOCABERLIN Version” (card game)

11 PM ~ 0 PM (GMT+1) – vocal synth disco with the big hits of all vocal synths!

Find more information of the program and a site plan here. Be sure to also read the site rules!

Follow VOCABERLIN on social media.

VNN will also keep you up to date for more vocal synth news!

Links

VOCABERLIN website
VOCABERLIN twitter
VOCABERLIN facebook
VOCABERLIN discord
JAMBerlin website

 

The post VOCABERLIN ✖ Luo Tianyi 7th Anniversary Event! appeared first on VNN.

item.content:encoded:

Coming up next… #MIKUEXPO2019 in HONG KONG pic.twitter.com/eU6VHPzP6y

— Hatsune Miku (@cfm_miku_en) May 11, 2019

The concert and exhibition events for Miku Expo 2019 in New Taipei City, Taiwan has come to a close! The concert setlist for the May 11th performance has also made its way online, thanks to Hatsune Miku fans attending the event. This will be your final spoiler warning if you did not attend the event

13. Yellow by kz feat. Hatsune Miku

16. Hello Worker by KEI feat. Megurine Luka
17. Never Die by Yuyoyuppe feat. Hatsune Miku

19. Blue Star by HachiojiP feat. Hatsune Miku
20. World is Mine by Ryo feat. Hatsune Miku
21. ODDS&ENDS by Ryo feat. Hatsune Miku
22. Lucky☆Orb by emon feat. Hatsune Miku

ENCORE
23. Decade by Dixie Flatline feat. Hatsune Miku
24. Music Like Magic! by Oster Project feat. Hatsune Miku
25. Tell Your World by kz feat. Hatsune Miku
Credit to @kure_39

The post Miku Expo 5th Anniversary x R4G Collaboration Apparel Revealed, Online Reservations Begin May 11th appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
A new collaboration has sprung from the recent Miku Expo 5th anniversary MV, and brought about new collaboration apparel from Respect for Geeks (R4G)! These new collaboration apparel are based on the MV “Lucky☆Orb” by emon(Tes.), directed by Fantasista Utamaro, whom also directored of  kz‘s”Tell Your World“.

The new collaboration apparel will be available at Miku Expo 2019 exhibition in Taiwan, or as online reservations on SHEL’TTER WEB STORE from May 11th onward. Below is an overview of the apparel.

  • LUCKY☆ORB TEE / MIKU BLUE S/M/L/XL
  • MIKUMOJI TEE S/M/L/XL
  • LUCKY☆ORB MIKU ART TEE S/M/L/XL color: Black / White
  • MIKUMOJI LONG SLEEVE TEE S/M/L/XL
  • LUCKU☆ORB ZIPUP HOODIE S/M/L/XL
  • MIKUMOJI PATTERN HOODIE S/M/L/XL
  • MIKUMOJI EMBROIDERY CAP
  • MIKUMOJI JACQUARD SOCKS
  • MIKUMOJI TIGHTS
  • MIKUMOJI SACOCHE
  • MIKUMOJI BACKPACK
  • MIKUMOJI TOWEL L, S
  • MIKUMOJI ORB PEN LIGHT
  • MIKUMOJI RUBBER STRAP
  • LUCKY☆ORB KAKEJIKU (TAPESTORY)

MIKU EXPO: https://mikuexpo.com/

item.title: Snow Miku 2020 Design Finalists Announced, Voting Website Launched & Livestream Summary
item.dc:creator: Spookie
item.description:
Good Smile Company’s “Snow Miku Time” livestream event has finished, and has a lot of exciting news to share! If you missed the live stream event, you can rewatch the YouTube recording for as long as it’s available. Let’s get started on the announcements! Even though it was the last part of the live stream, the reveal …

The post Snow Miku 2020 Design Finalists Announced, Voting Website Launched & Livestream Summary appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
Good Smile Company’s “Snow Miku Time” livestream event has finished, and has a lot of exciting news to share! If you missed the live stream event, you can rewatch the YouTube recording for as long as it’s available. Let’s get started on the announcements!

Even though it was the last part of the live stream, the reveal of the Snow Miku and Yukine 2020 design finalists is what everyone was waiting for! Here’s the list of the 6 finalists:

#1: “Grand Piano” by 杏夏蜜柑 → https://piapro.jp/t/saxQ
#2: “Taiko” by こり → https://piapro.jp/t/YxrR
#3: “Horn” by メープル → https://piapro.jp/t/HnGM
#4: “Accordion” by mgr → https://piapro.jp/t/sWBP
#5: “Flute” by 二六時中 → https://piapro.jp/t/lO2m
#6: “Marching Band” by ππ → https://piapro.jp/t/P9Kf

Community voting will be counted until May 17th, JST. Only one vote per person/device will be counted! The winning design will be announced at Magical Mirai 2019.

-> CLICK HERE TO VOTE! <-
Magical Mirai 2019

A new piece of artwork showing off Magical Mirai 2019 themed outfits for Kagamine Rin & Len, Megurine Luka, KAITO and MEIKO were revealed during the livestream. Expect these designs to play part in decorations and goods for Magical Mirai 2019!

The Nendoroid Hatsune Miku: Magical Mirai 2018 ver. was also announced during the stream! Details regarding pricing and release date were not yet announced, but we can expect to hear more soon.

Racing Miku 2019

Good Smile Company announced a 1/8 scale figure for Racing Miku 2018, based on the art design by Annin Oiko! There’s only a prototype sculpture being teased for now. Expect a painted version to be revealed, along with pricing and release info at a later date.

Good Smile Racing and Nitroplus are collaborating together again this year with Racing Miku and Super Sonico. Two new artworks by Minoa and 津路参汰 were released as part of this collaboration. Other details of the collaboration will come at a later time.

Other Goods & Collabs

A scale figure of Hatsune Miku Symphony 2018~2019 will be made! The figure will be based on the original artwork by Rella. Other details are not yet available, so keep watching for that.

Also, a Hatsune Miku x Macaron collaboration was announced, which will make special Cryptonloid themed Macaroons available, along with an A2 size visual poster!

Lastly, SEGA announced the availability and release dates for the following prize plushies and figures: Hatsune Miku: White Dress ver. plushie (releases 3rd week of May 2019), Hatsune Miku: White Dress ver. premium figure (releases 4th week of May 2019), a new trio of Hatsune Miku keychain plushies (releases 3rd week of June 2019) and Mega Jumbo Fuwafuwa ver. Sakura Miku plushie (on preorder at Chara-Ani until May 28th).

Source: Mikufan.com

The post Snow Miku 2020 Design Finalists Announced, Voting Website Launched & Livestream Summary appeared first on VNN.

item.title: Hatsune Miku: Magical Mirai 2019 Dates Announced, Additional Information to Follow in March
item.dc:creator: mikufan.com
item.description:
Recently announced at the SCARTS venue in Snow Miku 2019, the dates for Hatsune Miku: Magical Mirai 2019 are finally here. Hatsune Miku: Magical Mirai 2019 will take place at INTEX Osaka and Makuhari Messe in Osaka and Tokyo, respectively. The first to be held is in Osaka on August 9th~11th, follow up with Tokyo on August …

The post Hatsune Miku: Magical Mirai 2019 Dates Announced, Additional Information to Follow in March appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
Recently announced at the SCARTS venue in Snow Miku 2019, the dates for Hatsune Miku: Magical Mirai 2019 are finally here. Hatsune Miku: Magical Mirai 2019 will take place at INTEX Osaka and Makuhari Messe in Osaka and Tokyo, respectively. The first to be held is in Osaka on August 9th~11th, follow up with Tokyo on August 30th~September 1st.

The official Magical Mirai website has also been updated accordingly, and teases more information to follow in March. Stay tuned!

Official site → https://magicalmirai.com/2019/
Official Twitter → https://twitter.com/magicalmirai

Source: Mikufan.com

The post Hatsune Miku: Magical Mirai 2019 Dates Announced, Additional Information to Follow in March appeared first on VNN.
